Description.Details:
You and Darius have finished networking for new contracts on {TGT_SYSTEM.Name} and find yourself in the tiniest dive bar in the port, along with [[TGT_MW,{TGT_MW.Callsign}]], who is on shore leave.

Darius groans as a musician mounts the stage and begins to tune his guitar. {TGT_MW.Callsign} laughs. "Come on, give the guy a chance."

And so he begins...

	"{COMMANDER.Callsign}!
	The MechWarrior called... {COMMANDER.Callsign}!"

Darius and {TGT_MW.Callsign} exchange jaw-dropped looks. The musician continues, while the rest of the bar sings along.

	"The Steiners attacked, and we hid underground.
	We couldn't escape, we soon would be found.
	Our love for {COMMANDER.OBJ} ain't hard to explain.
	The Hero of the Valley,
	{COMMANDER.Callsign} is {COMMANDER.DET} name!"

There are four more verses.
Description.Name: The Hero of the Valley

Description.Details:
You stare daggers at [[TGT_MW,{TGT_MW.Callsign}]]. "You breathe a word about this, and you'll be riding a Spider until the day you die. Which is likely on the first deployment."

{TGT_MW.Callsign} gulps audibly, but Darius can barely contain his mirth. Your XO pats you on the shoulder. "Come on, Commander, all PR is good PR. Maybe we can work this to our advantage."

Seeing the look on your face, he amends his statement. "Or not..."

The waitress, who was about to ask if you'd like another round, does a deft pirouette and continues her tour amongst the other tables.
Description.Name: MW keeps mouth shut

Description.Details: You stare daggers at [[TGT_MW,{TGT_MW.Callsign}]]. "If you breathe a word about this, you'll be piloting a Spider until the day you die. Which is likely on the first deployment." {TGT_MW.Callsign} gulps audibly, but Darius can barely contain his mirth. Your XO pats you on the shoulder, "Come on, Commander, all PR is good PR. Maybe we can work this to our advantage." Later that week, moments before you arrive in the mess hall, you swear you hear the sounds of a guitar and one of the verses of The Hero of the Valley. But when you enter, everyone is eating in conspicuous silence.
Description.Name: MW tells the story anyway
Make a recording to bring back to the Argo.

Description.Details: Seeing your nod of concession, [[TGT_MW,{TGT_MW.Callsign}]] pulls out a recorder and begins capturing the performance. There's even an encore, so {TGT_MW.SUBJ} {TGT_MW.Gender?NonBinary:get|Default:gets} the whole thing from the beginning. Back on the Argo, the video from the bar circulates quickly among the MechWarriors and crew. It's not surprising that there were disagreements with your decision at the time to help the embattled locals. But knowing that the company's actions have become folk song legend? Attitudes have completely turned around. The technicians in the MechBay, in particular, have taken to singing The Hero of the Valley almost non-stop. Yang complains about it half-heartedly, but productivity is certainly higher!
Description.Name: MechTech boost

Back on the Argo, the video from the bar circulates quickly among the MechWarriors and crew. It's not surprising that there were disagreements with your decision at the time to help the embattled locals. But knowing that the company's actions have become folk song legend? Attitudes have completely turned around. The staff in the MedBay, in particular, have taken to singing The Hero of the Valley almost non-stop. MechWarriors in recovery have complained about it half-heartedly, but recovery time is certainly faster, perhaps to get away from the singing.
Description.Name: MedTech boost
Introduce yourself and buy a round for the bar.

Description.Details:
As the chords of the final verse fade away, and the applause dies down, you stand on your chair and raise your glass. "A toast!" The room responds with gusto.

"It's a delightful song to be sure, but I don't know that you truly captured the drama of the escape in the third verse. You see... I was there."

A patron close to your table, with a good look at the insignia on [[TGT_MW,{TGT_MW.Callsign}]]'s jacket, stands and points at you. "It's {COMMANDER.Callsign}! It's really {COMMANDER.OBJ}!"

The rest of the afternoon involves the telling and retelling of the story, and many offers to buy the next round of drinks. By the time you pour yourselves into the shuttle bound for space, {TGT_MW.Callsign} is positively glowing from the adoration from the crowd. "Commander, we really made a difference. We gave hope to these people."
Description.Name: high spirits
